title: barkerp
author: barkerp
created_time: November 20, 2023, 05:35:06 AMLast edit: November 22, 2023, 04:45:39 AM by barkerp
content: When was the last time you were buying or selling any sort of asset, not just crypto, where you thought about the real sentiments of other people investing in the same assets? Probably doesn't cross most minds. Exchanges are seen as kind of robotic and lifeless, only really showing trading as statistical. However behind every trade of every asset there is a human (or at least a bot programmed by a human and running for a human) that most likely has real feelings about what they are buying and selling. If it's a stock then maybe they just really like the company's direction or its product. If it's a cryptocurrency then they most likely really like the project and what it aims to do. If they're selling the coin or token then they most likely see some sort of downtrend in the market or the project could be going downhill. Despite all of this there is no real way to tell what people are thinking about a given token or coin in real time. Sure you can see what's trending on Twitter or maybe go look through wallstreetbets but Twitter is dominated by influencers and it could be difficult to analyze any sort of consensus on Reddit of all places. All of typical social media has a lot of bias and analysis isn't really effective by just browsing. What if there was an exchange in which people could discuss the assets their trading collectively while they are trading them? What if you could see in real-time who is buying what? What if all of these interactions and sentiments to assets are recorded, analyzed, and organized automatically by AI? This is where Chatswap.ai comes in. Chatswap is a simple DEX that aims to allow users to interact with each other while they trade, see each other's actions, and automatically analyze this to present to users the current trends on people's minds. With this you don't have to only rely on making decisions only around statistical analysis, which is a great option on its own, but now you can see how real people feel towards a project.Chatswap right now is in its VERY early stages and is currently only an alpha product. However here are the current features it has implemented:- Token AMM swapping via a liquidity aggregator- A global chat for discourse with everyone on the app- Current trades of users being posted in the chat in real-timeThere are many features planned for it but here are a few of the notable ones:- AI trends table that shows organized sentiment analysis of users towards a given token- Swapping on multiple chains (right now swapping on only the Ethereum network is implemented)- Community events such as airdrops- Charting tools for technical analysis- Staking and Liquidity mining- The eventual conversion to a DAO- Shared portfolios and NFT supportCheck it out at https://www.chatswap.ai and if you'd like to contact me directly you can at contact@chatswap.ai

Let's say you saw a lot of trades of a particular token happening in the chat or a lot of people having genuine conversation about a token, you maybe could use that information to make a buy or sell decision. It's not to replace expert analysis by any means but since the market is dictated by the collection of individual users, knowing the "average" of what they think as a whole could be useful.Quote from: Yamane_Keto on November 21, 2023, 01:41:59 AMHow will you ensure that abuse is prevented, since the pumping team can register hundreds of accounts and fool the artificial intelligence that there is activity for traders to buy a specific pair?I have already implemented methods to stop spamming of my API and to the chat. If you manually try to send more than a few chats per second right now the server will stop you. This alone will not stop pumping but there are a few methods I am working towards right now such as chat voting. Chat voting would basically mean that users can upvote or downvote chats, which will greatly affect their gravity on the AI. This can also be based on the user where if a user gets a certain amount of downvotes in a certain amount of time, then their chats' effect on the AI can be nullified. Methods like these plus IP tracking and a reputation system based on IP/user can be implemented as well.Quote from: Yamane_Keto on November 21, 2023, 01:41:59 AMWill you be able to display the trading results on the platform and the real-time prices so we can compare them?Absolutely, real-time pricing exists right now if you select a pair and type in a value to trade. comments.body: Quote from: moneystery on November 22, 2023, 02:06:04 AMQuote from: barkerp on November 20, 2023, 05:35:06 AMSure you can see what's trending on Twitter or maybe go look through wallstreetbets but Twitter is dominated by influencers and it could be difficult to analyze any sort of consensus on Reddit of all places. All of typical social media has a lot of bias and analysis isn't really effective by just browsing.what today's online platforms cannot overcome are problems related to bots, bias, influencers, etc., and these will not be eliminated by online platforms no matter how they address them. and i'm sure that the swap platform you offer will not be separated from these things, trust me. even a company the size of x (twitter) still has difficulty managing their platform with these problems, let alone a new platform like yours. all activities on your platform can be manipulated by people and when the AI technology that you set analyzes this information, in the end it makes wrong recommendations which have the potential to make people lose money.Chatswap is not aiming to make any recommendations for what people should or should not do when it comes to trading. It simply is presenting data based on AI analysis of users interacting with the platform. Just like with any sort of financial indicator or tool, it's down to the person actually trading to make their own decisions. There will be no buy recommendation or sell recommendation, simply what the AI makes of different chats and interactions. This is a basic description of what the AI trends table will look like: It will show the token, how many chats the AI has detected relevant to it, the time period for which it has been relevant, and the overall sentiment of the user activity on a scale of 1 to 10. I'm thinking there will be an option to click on the asset and see the list of the most relevant chats, just so you can see exactly what the AI was taking into consideration.I also agree that any platform, including Chatswap, will not be able to fully overcome the influence of bots and those with malicious intent. However Chatswap is specifically designed to facilitate the discourse of blockchain projects and cryptocurrency and will make specific measures to help prevent bots and malicious influence through the design of its AI and with anti-spamming measures on its servers. Platforms like Twitter/X and Reddit are not designed towards this end, but instead only implement solutions to prevent spamming as a whole. I'm not saying that Chatswap will achieve this fully but there isn't really a platform that can.
